Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Voodoo \Voo"doo\, n. 1. See {Voodooism}. [1913 Webster]
2. One who practices voodooism; a negro sorcerer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Voodoo \Voo"doo\, a. Of or pertaining to voodooism, or a voodoo; as, voodoo incantations. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: VOODOO Versions Of Outdated Documents Organized Orthogonally (Mac)

voodoo n 1: a charm superstitiously believed to embody magical powers [syn: {juju}, {hoodoo}, {fetish}, {fetich}] 2: a religious cult practiced chiefly in Caribbean countries (especially Haiti); involves witchcraft and animistic deities [syn: {vodoun}, {voodooism}, {hoodooism}] v : bewitch by or as if by a voodoo
